Dgame.Graphics.Sprite



class Sprite: Dgame.Graphics.Transformable.Transformable, Dgame.Graphics.Drawable.Drawable;
Sprite represents a drawable object and maintains a texture and his position.

Author:
rschuett

this();
CTor

this(Texture tex);
CTor

pure nothrow ref const(Vector2s) calculateCenter();
Calculate, store and return the center point.

const bool collideWith(const Sprite rhs);
Check whether the bounding box of this Sprite collide with the bounding box of another Sprite

const bool collideWith(ref const ShortRect rect);
Check whether the bounding box of this Sprite collide with the given Rect

const bool collideWith(const ShortRect rect);
Rvalue version

final void setTextureRect(ref const ShortRect texView);
Set a Texture Rect. This indicates which area of the Texture is drawn.

final void setTextureRect(const ShortRect texView);
Rvalue version

final const bool hasTextureRect();
Returns if this Texture has a Texture Rect

final void resetTextureRect();
Reset the current Texture Rect with a call to Rect.collapse

final const pure nothrow ref const(ShortRect) getTextureRect();
Returns the current Texture Rect

final const pure nothrow ref const(ShortRect) getClipRect();
Returns the clip rect, the area which will be drawn on the screen.

final const pure nothrow bool hasTexture();
Check if the current Sprite has already a Texture/Image. If not, nothing can be drawn. But it does not check if the current Texture is valid.

final void setTexture(Texture tex);
Set or replace the current Texture.

final inout inout(Texture) getTexture();
Returns the current Texture or null if there is none.
